	<item>
		<title>Blogueurs invités</title>
		<link>http://ponabana.com/bloggers-invites/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 03 Jan 2014 08:55:45 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>adrien</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://ponabana.com/?page_id=3555</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<h1>Christopher Pycroft - Chef de mission de la Coopération Britannique en RDC</h1>
<a href="http://ponabana.com/author/christopher-pycroft/" target="_blank"><img class="size-full wp-image-5652 alignleft" alt="chris-pycroft" src="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/01/chris-pycroft.jpg" width="150" height="150" /></a>Christopher Pycroft est le chef de mission de la Coopération Britannique (DFID) en République Démocratique du Congo depuis Août 2011.

Il a auparavant travaillé comme conseiller en gouvernance au sein de DFID Nigeria et DFID Asie du Sud-Est, et en tant que chef adjoint de DFID en Afghanistan.

Selon lui, la mission de DFID en RDC est passionnante car il s'agit de trouver des manières innovantes et efficaces de soutenir la réduction de la pauvreté dans un pays immense et complexe. Ne ratez pas son article écrit à l'occasion de la journée mondiale de l'eau: <a href="/?p=5637" target="_blank">Mayi po na bana ya RDC (De l’eau pour les enfants de la RDC)</a>

[separator]
<h1>Jeremy Gilley - Acteur, réalisateur et fondateur de Peace One Day</h1>
<a href="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/01/Jeremy-Gilley-Peace-One-Day-and-children-North-Kivu.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-5353 alignleft" alt="Jeremy Gilley Peace One Day and children North Kivu" src="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/01/Jeremy-Gilley-Peace-One-Day-and-children-North-Kivu-200x300.jpg" width="200" height="300" /></a>

Jeremy Gilley est un acteur, devenu par la suite réalisateur. Vers la fin des années 1990, il a commencé à s'interroger sur les fondements de la nature humaine et sur la question de la paix. Il a alors décidé d'explorer ces questions au travers de films et, plus particulièrement, de produire un documentaire sur sa campagne pour instaurer une journée annuelle de cessez-le-feu et de non-violence. L’objectif du projet de Peace One Day dans l’est de la République Démocratique du Congo (RDC) et dans la région des Grands Lacs est d’encourager toutes les parties à s’unir au nom de la paix le 21 septembre.

Découvrez son témoignage sur le rôle des jeunes dans la construction de la paix: <a href="/?p=5336">http://ponabana.com/comment-construire-la-paix-commencez-avec-les-jeunes/</a>

Pour plus d’informations sur Peace One Day:  <a href="http://www.peaceoneday.org/fr/" target="_blank">http://www.peaceoneday.org/fr/</a>

[separator]
<h1>Sylvie Vwiranda - Psychologue</h1>
<a href="/?p=5003"><img class=" wp-image-5027 alignleft" alt="sylvievw2" src="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/01/sylvievw2.jpg" width="210" height="247" /></a>

Spécialisée en psychologie clinique, Sylvie a grandi dans le Nord-Kivu. Aujourd'hui, elle offre une aide psycho-sociale aux victimes de violences sexuelles et travaille sur le bâtiment de la sensibilisation et la capacitation du personnel médical, mais aussi les autorités de l'État qui sont impliquées dans la lutte contre les violences sexuelles et l'aide aux victimes.

Elle a écrit un article passionnant intitulé: <a href="/?p=5003" target="_blank">"Apporter un appui psychologique aux victimes de violences sexuelles"</a>

<span style="font-size: 2em;">[separator]</span>
<h1>Mariya Gabriel - Eurodéputée</h1>
<a href="/?p=4879"><img class="wp-image-4952 alignleft" alt="Mariya-Gabriel" src="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/01/Mariya-Gabriel.jpg" width="230" height="230" /></a>Mariya Gabriel est membre du Parlement européen depuis 2009, au sein du Groupe du Parti Populaire Européen (Démocrates-Chrétiens). Élue bulgare, elle est membre de la Délégation à l'Assemblée parlementaire paritaire Afrique, Caraïbes, Pacifique - Union Européenne ainsi que des Commissions de l'Agriculture et du développement rural et des Pétitions.

L'eurodéputée a partagé avec les lecteurs de Pona Bana son engagement pour la réduction de la mortalité maternelle et infantile en RDC: <a href="/?p=4879" target="_blank">Restons mobilisés pour réduire la mortalité maternelle et infantile</a>

[separator]
<h1>Patricia Willocq - Photographe</h1>
<a href="/?p=4828"><img class=" wp-image-4853 alignleft" alt="5498299_orig" src="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/01/5498299_orig.jpg" width="252" height="168" /></a>

Patricia Willocq est née et a grandi à Kinshasa (Congo RDC). Elle a parcouru le monde entre Irlande, Belgique, Emirats Arabes, Chili, Thailande ou encore Congo.

Son intérêt pour la photographie a débuté après avoir été publiée deux fois dans le magazine chilien Geografica. Depuis, elle ne cesse d'évoluer dans ce domaine. Si depuis un an elle travaille principalement comme photographe de mode, elle continue néanmoins à évoluer dans le domaine de la photographie de voyage, de nature et de maternité. Son travail à été publié dans plusieurs magazines à travers le monde plus particulièrement au Chili, en France, en Turquie et au Congo.

Elle a écrit un article pour <a href="/?p=4828" target="_blank">Pona Bana à propos de son exposition "Blanc Ebène" sur les enfants albinos.</a>

Découvrez son travail sur: <a href="http://www.patriciawillocq.com/" target="_blank">http://www.patriciawillocq.com/</a>

<span style="font-size: 2em;">[separator]</span>
<h1>Annika Ben David - Ambassadrice de Suède en République Démocratique du Congo</h1>
<h1><a href="/?p=4807"><img class=" wp-image-4822 alignleft" alt="Annika BD 2" src="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/01/Annika-BD-2.jpg" width="122" height="182" /></a></h1>
Annika Ben David est le nouvel Ambassadeur de Suède en RD Congo depuis septembre 2013. Mme Ben David vient d’une fonction comme sous-directeur et Chef de Section au Département Afrique du Ministère des affaires étrangères de Suède, ce qui lui a permis de visiter à plusieurs reprises la RDC, l’est du pays inclus, avant qu’elle ne soit nommée Ambassadeur. Elle a été affectée à l’Ambassade de Suède en Tanzanie, et deux fois à l’Ambassade de Suède en Israël.

Avant de rejoindre le services diplomatiques suédois, elle a travaillé au UNHCR.

Retrouvez son article sur<a href="/?p=4807" target="_blank"> la protection des enfants contre le recrutement et l'utilisation par des forces et groupes armés.</a>

[separator]
<h1>Pascal Bijleveld - Spécialiste de la santé maternelle, néonatale et infantile</h1>
<a href="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/01/Pascal-Bijleveld.jpg"><img class=" wp-image-5358 alignleft" alt="Pascal Bijleveld" src="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/01/Pascal-Bijleveld-200x300.jpg" width="160" height="240" /></a>Pascal Bijleveld est Responsable Senior pour le Fonds pour la santé reproductive, maternelle, néonatale et infantile de l'UNICEF à New York. Expert en santé publique depuis plus de dix ans, son engagement l'a mené de nombreuses années au Kenya et au Rwanda notamment.

Suite à sa visite de terrain en RDC, Pascal Bijleveld nous a fait part de ses réflexions sur les efforts pour réduire la mortalité maternelle et infantile dans le pays:<em> </em><a href="/?p=4490" target="_blank">http://ponabana.com/comment-reduire-la-mortalite-de-la-mere-et-du-jeune-enfant-en-rdc/</a>

[separator]
<h1>Aloys Kamuragiye - Représentant de l'UNICEF en République du Congo</h1>
<a href="/?p=4469"><img class=" wp-image-4467 alignleft" alt="Aloys Kamuragiye Representant UNICEF Congo" src="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/01/Aloys-Kamuragiye-Representant-UNICEF-Congo.jpg" width="179" height="119" /></a>Aloys Kamuragiye est Représentant de l'UNICEF en République du Congo. D'abord médecin, il travaille depuis plus de 20 ans pour les enfants avec l'UNICEF. Son engagement l'a mené du Burundi en Guinée, puis à Madagascar, aux Comores, et comme Représentant de l'UNICEF à Djibouti et au Maroc.

Après avoir rendu visite à l'UNICEF RDC pour la réunion de son équipe de gestion et d’innovation (COMIT), il leur a adressé une lettre ouverte, que vous pouvez consulter sur<a href="/?p=4469"> ce lien</a>. <em>
</em>

[separator]
<h1>Yoka Brandt - Directrice Générale adjointe de l'UNICEF</h1>
<a href="http://ponabana.com/author/yoka/"><img class="size-full wp-image-4004 alignleft" alt="UNI121944_160" src="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/01/UNI121944_160.jpg" width="128" height="192" /></a>
<p style="text-align: justify;">Yoka Brandt a rejoint l'UNICEF en février 2012 au poste de Directrice générale adjointe pour les affaires extérieures.  Elle dispose de 20 ans d'expérience dans le domaine de l'aide internationale et l'action humanitaire d'urgence.</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">Tout au long de sa carrière, Yoka Brandt s'est intéressée aux questions de développement, en particulier sur l'Afrique et le plaidoyer pour l'éradication de la pauvreté.</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">Elle a publié son carnet de bord sur Pona Bana lors de son voyage en RDC au mois de janvier 2014 que vous pouvez retrouver en cliquant <a href="http://ponabana.com/author/yoka/" target="_blank">sur ce lien</a>.</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;"><em><strong>Crédit photo : </strong>© UNICEF/NYHQ2012-0057/Susan Markisz<strong>.</strong></em></p>
[separator]
<h1>Diana Mrazikova - Photographe</h1>
<p style="text-align: justify;"><a href="/?p=3548"><img class="alignleft" alt="diana 2" src="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/01/diana-2.jpg" width="272" height="134" /></a>De Los Angeles à Dakat en passant par Prague et La Havanne, Diana a travaillé avec les plus grands magazine et notamment le Cosmopolitan, Marie Claire, Esquire, OK! Magazine.</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">En Afrique, elle a produit des documentaires multimedia, photos et courts métrages pour des organisations telles que UNICEF, JHUCCP/ USAID, ICRC... Consultez l'ensemble de son portfolio sur: www.dianamrazikova.com</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">Sa photo "Une mère et son enfant à Lubumbashi" a été élue par les amis et soutiens de Unicef RDC "Photo de l'année 2013". Son article est disponible à l'adresse suivante:</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;"><a href="/?p=3548">http://ponabana.com/voici-la-photo-de-lannee-2013/</a></p>]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Special Guests</title>
		<link>http://ponabana.com/special-guests/?lang=en</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 03 Jan 2014 08:57:15 +0000</pubDate>

		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<h1>Diana Mrazikova - Photographer</h1>
<a href="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/01/diana-2.jpg"><img class="alignleft" alt="diana 2" src="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/01/diana-2.jpg" width="272" height="134" /></a>From Los Angeles to Dakar via Prague and Havana, Diana has worked for various magazine clients including Cosmopolitan, Marie Claire, Esquire, OK! Magazine as well as advertising clients such as Orange France Telecom or Societe Generale Bank.

In Africa she has produced multimedia documentary short films &amp; photo features for international non profit organizations such as UNICEF, JHUCCP/ USAID, ICRC... You can see all her NGO work portfolio at: www.dianamrazikova.com

Her picture "Mother and her child in Kinshasa" has been elected "2013 Photo of the year" by Unicef DRC followers. Read her article here:]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Our Bloggers</title>
		<link>http://ponabana.com/our-bloggers/?lang=en</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 08 Jan 2014 12:27:37 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Justine</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://ponabana.com/?page_id=3636</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[one_third]
<h4>Barbara Bentein</h4>
<a href="http://ponabana.com/author/barbara/"><img class="aligncenter" alt="56" src="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/56.jpg" width="390" height="263" /></a><em> Barbara Bentein has been UNICEF Representative in DRC since 2011. She has worked for almost 30 years for UNICEF, advocating for the respect of the rights of children and a fairer world. Before DRC, she had been UNICEF Representative in Madagascar, Maurice and Comores and UNICEF Deputy Regional Director l’Unicef for Western and Central Africa.</em>

[/one_third][one_third]
<h4>Sylvie Fouet</h4>
<a href="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/Profil-bloggeur_Sylvie-Fouet-w.jpg"><img class="aligncenter" alt="UNICEF Deputy Representative Sylvie Fouet visits PEAR+ (Programme Elargi d?Assistance aux Retours) activities in the Matanda area of South Kivu. PEAR Plus provides an integrated package of assistance and capacity building to communities; local and state authorities in the sectors of Health, Water, Hygiene and Sanitation, Education and Child Protection.Sectorial specific activities include the following: School reconstruction, support to transparent and equitable structure management, teacher-training, support to parent/teacher associations, provision of education kits and didactic material. Restoration and development of sustainable access to safe water and healthy environment; rehabilitation of health centres, reinforcement of health staff and directors? capacities; provision of basic medical necessities; support to vaccination campaigns and community-based treatment for malnutrition as well as the identification and strengthening child protection networks and responses are all part of the Programme.   Accompanied by peacebuilding activities and interventions designed to improve social cohesion, emphasis is put on governance activities (linked to social service provision) and conflict risk reduction in order to keep the Programme relevant to the evolving context and consequent needs. Increased community participation and ownership, as well as a reinforcement of the social contract between community, local and state authorities are increasingly key outputs of PEAR+?s approach.   A more explicit relationship with UNICEF?s long term programming provides a clear exit strategy and guarantees a degree of sustainability in the medium term, whilst a closer alignment with UNICEF?s emergency response mechanisms and the integration of sectorial emergency preparedness helps improve community resilience to the impact of conflict.  In recognition of the fluid nature in the east, the objective is to develop a way of working which supports social and economic rehabilitation; reinforces community resilience and eases the transition to emergency assistance or longer term support." src="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/Profil-bloggeur_Sylvie-Fouet-w.jpg" width="494" height="353" /></a>

<em>Sylvie Fouet has been UNICEF Deputy Representative since 2011. She has been workinf for almost 20 years in international cooperation , of which 10 years with Unicef, supporting the respect of the rights of children and inclusive growth. Before DRC, she joined UNICEF Headquarters in New York, seconded to the European Union in Brussels. She also worked in Iraq, occupied Palestinian Territories, Sudan, Syria and Yemen. </em>
[/one_third][one_third_last]
<h4>Ndiaga Seck</h4>
<a href="http://ponabana.com/author/ndiaga/"><img class="aligncenter" alt="Profil bloggeur_Ndiaga Seck" src="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/Profil-bloggeur_Ndiaga-Seck-1024x731.jpg" width="375" height="268" /></a>

<em>Ndiaga Seck is a UNICEF Communications Specialist in Eastern DRC. He specializes in human and social studies, education and journalism. For the past eight years, he has worked with IRIN, OCHA, in West Africa. His leitmotiv: “A World fit for children is within reach. Let’s grab it!”</em>
<h4>[/one_third_last]</h4>
[separator]
[one_third]
<h4>Brett Morton</h4>
<a href="http://ponabana.com/author/brett/"><img class="aligncenter" alt="March 15, 2013 Kionvu, Mwenga, South Kivu, DRC UNICEF RRMP partner AVSI carries out NFI Fair. Since late 2012, fighting between rebels of the Raia Mutomboki  and the Congolese Army (FARDC) has lead to the displacement of more than 6,000 families around the village of Ngando, South Kivu, DRC. With more than 2.6 million currently displaced across eastern DRC, the Rapid Response to Movements of Populations (RRMP) program ? co-lead by UNICEF and OCHA and implemented by 6 INGO partners - aims to assist the most vulnerable of those affected by displacement, return and/or natural disasters, such as those of Ngando.  From February - April 2013, 6 rapid needs assessments were conducted by RRMP partner AVSI in villages surrounding Ngando. Approximately 3,300 of the most vulnerable families were identified to receive support through a Non-Food Item (NFI) Fair carried out over the course of 5 days in May near Mwenga Center, where the majority of displaced from Ngando had settled with host families.  Providing essential household items and emergency shelter materials has been a core component of UNICEF and partners? relief programs for displaced, returning displaced and other disaster-affected populations since 2004. Building upon existing relief programs for emergency-affected populations which include a significant NFI component, UNICEF and partners created the cash-based voucher NFI fair approach to allow beneficiaries to select goods and supplies according to their own priorities, leading to improved efficiency in NFI assistance and as well as greater participation of affected populations.  Operating in essence as a local market, beneficiaries are given cash vouchers, which vendors can then redeem for cash following the closure of the fair. The participating households are free to choose the items which will serve them best, while the local economy is reinforced through the participation of local vendors. This ?Fair Approach? represented more than 50% of RRMP NFI distributions in 2012, and is scheduled to account for 60% in 2013." src="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/Profil-bloggeur_Brett-Morton21.jpg" width="320" height="247" /></a>

<em>Brett Morton is a Communications Consultant at UNICEF. As a photographer and designer, he has spent the last 6 years covering humanitarian emergency and development  activities in East and Central Africa; he believes that images will shape our future, but maintains that these images are not worth sacrificing humanity to obtain. His leitmotiv? "When we are no longer able to change a situation... we are challenged to change ourselves." - V. Frankl</em>
<h4></h4>
[/one_third][one_third]
<h4>Sylvie Sona</h4>
<a href="http://ponabana.com/author/sylvie/"><img class="aligncenter" alt="Profil Sylvie" src="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/Profil-Sylvie.jpg" width="375" height="300" /></a>

<em>Sylvie SONA is a Communications Officer at UNICEF/South Zone. She is a journalist by trade and loves to write. She has made documenting the participation of children her mission. In her opinion, it is important to systematically record successes and to put children at the heart of every intervention. Her motto: “Give children a voice.”</em>
<h4>[/one_third][one_third_last]</h4>
<h4>Adrien Majourel</h4>
<h4><a href="http://ponabana.com/author/adrien/"><img class="aligncenter" alt="AM" src="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/AM1.jpg" width="541" height="408" /></a></h4>
<em>Adrien Majourel is Communications Officer at UNICEF DRC and manager of Pona Bana. Specialized in International Relations and Journalism, he believes it is important to give children a voice as what they see often slips from adult's grasp. l’importance de donner de la voix aux enfants car bien souvent ce qu'ils voient échappe à des yeux d'adultes. His leitmotiv ? « Children are luminous enigmas » Daniel Pennac</em>
<h4>[/one_third_last]</h4>
[separator]

[one_third]
<h4>Angèle Bijanu</h4>
<em><a href="http://ponabana.com/author/angele/"><img class="aligncenter" alt="angele" src="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/angele.jpg" width="370" height="247" /></a> Angèle Bijanu Mpoyi is Knowledge Management Officer at UNICEF DRC. An economist by training, she also worked for UNDP in DRC in Kasai Oriental and North-Kivu provinces, first as a Programme Officer, then as an Expert in Monitoring and Evaluation. Passionate about change for social good, she advocates for equity and justice, mostly for the most vulnerable. </em>

[/one_third][one_third]
<h4>Vanessa Wirth</h4>
<h4><a href="http://ponabana.com/author/vanessa/"><img class="aligncenter" alt="23504001_l_823d3a76f797e2d8fbee2efd0abf0f83" src="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/23504001_l_823d3a76f797e2d8fbee2efd0abf0f83.jpg" width="254" height="230" /></a></h4>
<em>Vanessa Wirth is a Child Protection Officer at UNICEF responsible for coordinating the Child Protection in Emergencies Working Group in Kinshasa. She specializes in Human Rights and strongly believes that protecting children's rights is the best approach to tackling their vulnerabilities and guaranteeing a smooth transition to adulthood. Her leitmotiv? Never stop dreaming.</em>

[/one_third][one_third_last]
<h4>Eric-Alain Ategbo</h4>
<a href="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/ATEGBO.jpg"><img class="aligncenter" alt="ATEGBO" src="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/ATEGBO.jpg" width="387" height="348" /></a>

<em>Eric-Alain Ategbo has been Senior Nutrition Specialist at UNICEF in RDC sine June 2013. He has been working with UNCEF since 2003. Beofre DRC, he has worked as a Nutrition Specialist in India, Uganda and Niger. Before joining UNICEF, Eric-Alain Ategbo was a teacher and researcher in the National University in Benin and has published several scientific publications on nutrition.</em>
<h4>[/one_third_last]</h4>
[separator]

[one_third]
<h4>Violeta Cojocaru</h4>
<a href="http://ponabana.com/author/violeta/"><img class="aligncenter" alt="violeta" src="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/violeta.jpg" width="498" height="332" /></a>

<em>Violeta Cojocaru has been the Head of Communications for Development (C4D) at UNICEF DRC since 2012. She has a 14-year experience at UNICEF, in DRC, Niger and Moldavia, and worked for 13 years in written and electronic media. She believes that to stimulate a positive sustainable development, communication and community and family capacity-buildingmust be a priority. This will increase the impact of our actions.</em>

[/one_third][one_third]
<h4>Anne-Cecile Vialle</h4>
<a href="http://ponabana.com/author/anne-cecile/"><img class="aligncenter" alt="Profil bloggeur_Anne-Cecile Vialle2" src="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/Profil-bloggeur_Anne-Cecile-Vialle2.jpg" width="370" height="278" /></a>

<em>Anne-Cecile Vialle is responsible for Quality Control at UNICEF DRC. She travels the country supporting field offices in the implementation of programmes, helping management increase the efficiency and effectiveness of internal work procedures and ultimately optimizing the quality and sustainability of UNICEF's impact on women and children in the DRC. Her leitmotiv: There are always more solutions than problems! </em>

[/one_third][one_third_last]
<h4>Felicien Molima</h4>
<a href="http://ponabana.com/author/felicien/"><img class="aligncenter" alt="Profil bloggeur_Felicien Molima" src="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/Profil-bloggeur_Felicien-Molima.jpg" width="496" height="372" /></a>

<em>Félicien has been Plannning and Cohesion Specialist at UNICEF Eastern DRC Zone Office in Goma since 2013. He has worked with UNICEF in DRC since 2001, as a Health Manager in Kisangani Office (6 years), Head of Kananga Office (2 years) and Head of North-Kivu Maniema Office (3 years) in Goma. He likes to go on visits in the field to learn on implementing partners as well as on beneficiaries and their context. </em>
<h4>[/one_third_last]</h4>
[separator]

[one_third]
<h4>Blanqui Ntambwe Kabongo</h4>
<a href="http://ponabana.com/author/blanqui/"><img class="aligncenter" alt="Profil bloggeur_Blanqui Ntambwe Kabongoweb" src="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/Profil-bloggeur_Blanqui-Ntambwe-Kabongoweb.jpg" width="503" height="336" /></a>
<p style="text-align: center;"><em>Blanqui Ntambwe Kabongo is "Education and Peace Consolidation" Programme Officer at UNICEF DRC. For 8 years, he has been working in Education, at the Ministry of Eduaction of the DRC and UNICEF. He believes that giving equitable access to quality primary education to children is an efficient strategy to build sustainable peace. His leitmotiv : “There is no bigger challenge, and no more noble cause than the protection of education” <em>!!!! </em>(M. Gordon Brown).</em></p>
[/one_third][one_third]
<h4>Bibiane Ambongo</h4>
<a href="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/Bibiane-Ambongo-2013.jpg"><img class="aligncenter" alt="Bibiane Ambongo" src="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/Bibiane-Ambongo-2013.jpg" width="377" height="251" /></a>
<p style="text-align: center;"><em>Bibiane Ambongo is a Communications Specialist at UNICEF Kinshasa, where she has worked for many years. She is particularly concerned with presenting the DRC as a country which is moving forward and finding its feet. And if children are at the heart of it all, they just have to be taken by the hand so they can reveal their talents. And Heaven knows, they have plenty! </em></p>
[/one_third][one_third_last]
<h4>Serge Wingi</h4>
<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/Profil-bloggeur_Serge-Wingi.jpg"><img class=" wp-image-3931 aligncenter" alt="Profil bloggeur_Serge Wingi" src="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/Profil-bloggeur_Serge-Wingi.jpg" width="499" height="333" /></a></p>
<p style="text-align: center;"><em>Serge Wingi is Communications Manager and focal point for Child Participation at UNICEF DRC. Specialized in Communication Sciences and Social Marketing, he firmly believe that children can change the world if we only invest in them. His passion : take an active part in mobilizing the community and policymakers to invest more in children. There is no success without a successor, they say. </em></p>

[one_third]
<h4>Justine Mounet</h4>
<p style="text-align: center;"><a href="http://ponabana.com/author/justine/"><img class=" wp-image-4370 aligncenter" alt="Justine Mounet_Blog" src="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/Justine-Mounet_Blog.jpg" width="381" height="254" /></a></p>
<p style="text-align: center;"><em>Justine Mounet is Communications Officer at UNICEF in Kinshasa. She believes that advocacy and participation are essential to reach peace and realize everyone's rights. She engaged with children as she believes that they are key to changing a society for the better. Her leitmotiv ? There is no path to happiness, happiness is the path.</em></p>

	<item>
		<title>Who are we?</title>
		<link>http://ponabana.com/who-are-we/?lang=en</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 14 Jan 2014 16:15:34 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Justine</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://ponabana.com/?page_id=3760</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[one_third]

<strong>Pona Bana is the UNICEF DRC team's blog.</strong>

Here our team of bloggers and partners share their experiences of working on the ground and their passion for children's rights in the DRC.

Reports, key figures, programme documents, topical articles, photos, videos and graphics, you can find out everything about the situation of children in the DRC and how we are working with our partners to ensure that their rights are respected.

[/one_third]

[one_third]

<strong>"Voices of Children” </strong>

We are convinced that as the main beneficiaries of our work, children should be consulted, heard and taken into account.

A forum will soon be set up for children to exchange their ideas, where regular <a href="/?cat_ID=122">articles</a>, <a href="/?cat_ID=121">cartoons </a>and <a href="http://www.youtube.com/user/unicefrdc2012?feature=watch">videos </a>will be posted.

[/one_third]

[one_third_last]

<strong>Your Participation</strong>

Your views and opinions are important to us.

Please do not hesitate to ask our specialists any questions you may have, to comment on our articles or tell us about your ideas, concerns or suggestions. This blog aims to continuously improve and be enhanced by adapting to your needs.

Together, we can build a better future for the children of the DRC!

[/one_third_last]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Partners</title>
		<link>http://ponabana.com/partners/?lang=en</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 14 Jan 2014 16:31:36 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Justine</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://ponabana.com/?page_id=3763</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/05/DSC_1011.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1441 aligncenter" alt="Youths smiling at Plateau, one of the poorest neighborhood of Kikwit." src="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/05/DSC_1011.jpg" /></a>

<strong>UNICEF DRC's work is made possible thanks to the support and work of our partners. We would like to express our deepest gratitude to the following institutions and organisations:</strong>

<strong>BILATERALS</strong>

<a href="https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/department-for-international-development" target="_blank">United Kingdom</a>, <a href="http://www.usaid.gov/">USA</a> , <a href="http://ec.europa.eu/echo/about/">European Commission/ECHO</a>, <a href="http://ponabana.com/donateurs/www.mofa.go.jp/%E2%80%8E">Japan</a>, <a href="http://ponabana.com/donateurs/www.sida.se/english/" target="_blank">SIDA – Sweden</a>, <a href="http://www.international.gc.ca/international/index.aspx?lang=fra">Canada</a>,<a href="http://diplomatie.belgium.be/fr/sur_lorganisation/organigramme_et_structure/dgd/" target="_blank">Belgium</a>, <a href="http://www.deza.admin.ch/fr/Accueil" target="_blank">Switzerland</a>, <a href="http://rdc.primature.cd/">Democratic Republic of Congo</a>, <a href="http://www.regjeringen.no/en/dep/ud.html?id=833" target="_blank">Norway</a>, <a href="http://www.exteriores.gob.es/PORTAL/ES/POLITICAEXTERIORCOOPERACION/COOPERACIONALDESARROLLO/Paginas/Inicio.aspx" target="_blank">Spain</a>,<a href="http://www.koica.go.kr/english/main.html" target="_blank">Republic of Korea</a>, <a href="http://www.state.gov/j/prm/">USA Bureau of Population, Refugees and Migration</a>

<strong>MULTILATERALS</strong>

<a href="http://mptf.undp.org/">UNDP – MDTF (Pooled Fund)</a>, <a href="https://www.rotary.org/fr">Rotary International</a>, <a href="http://www.unocha.org/cerf/">UNOCHA (CERF), </a>Global – Thematic Humanitarian Resp, Donor Pooled Fund (mixed donors), <a href="http://ponabana.com/donateurs/www.unfpa.org/%E2%80%8E">UNFPA – USA</a>,<a href="http://www.unfoundation.org/">United Nations Foundation Inc</a>., <a href="http://ponabana.com/donateurs/www.undp.org/%E2%80%8E">UNDP – USA</a>, <a href="http://ponabana.com/donateurs/www.micronutrient.org/%E2%80%8E">Micronutrient Initiative</a>, <a href="http://ponabana.com/donateurs/www.who.int/fr/">WHO</a>,<a href="http://unocha.org/humansecurity/">UNTFHS</a>, <a href="http://www.unaids.org/fr/">UNAIDS</a>, <a href="http://www.mineaction.org/">UNMAS – New York</a>, <a href="http://cpwg.net/">Global – Child Protection</a>

<strong>UNICEF NATIONAL COMMITTEES</strong>

<a href="http://www.unicefusa.org/">United States Fund for UNICEF</a>, <a href="http://ponabana.com/donateurs/www.unicef.de/%E2%80%8E">German Committee for UNICEF</a>, <a href="http://ponabana.com/donateurs/www.unicef.fr/%E2%80%8E">French Committee for UNICEF</a>, <a href="http://ponabana.com/donateurs/www.unicef.be/fr%E2%80%8E">Belgian Committee for UNICEF</a>, <a href="http://ponabana.com/donateurs/www.unicef.ch/fr%E2%80%8E">Swiss Committee for UNICEF</a>, <a href="http://ponabana.com/donateurs/www.unicef.it/%E2%80%8E">Italian National Committee</a>, <a href="http://ponabana.com/donateurs/www.unicef.es/%E2%80%8E">Spanish Committee for UNICEF</a>, <a href="http://ponabana.com/donateurs/www.unicef.ca/fr%E2%80%8E">Canadian UNICEF Committee</a>,<a href="http://ponabana.com/donateurs/www.unicef.org.uk/">United Kingdom Committee for UNICEF</a>, Consolidated Funds from UNICEF National Committees, <a href="http://ponabana.com/donateurs/www.unicef.lu/%E2%80%8E">Luxembourg Committee for UNICEF</a>

<strong>PRIVATE AND PUBLIC-PRIVATE FUNDS</strong>

<a href="http://ponabana.com/donateurs/www.gatesfoundation.org/%E2%80%8E">Bill &amp; Melinda Gates Foundation</a>, <a href="http://ponabana.com/donateurs/www.gavialliance.org/%E2%80%8E">GAVI Fund</a>]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Key Facts and Figures</title>
		<link>http://ponabana.com/key-facts-and-figures/?lang=en</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 14 Jan 2014 16:36:34 +0000</pubDate>

<strong>You can find key information about our progress towards the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) as well as about the situation of children in the DRC in the document below. </strong>

<a href="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/MDG_Profile_Congo-Democratic-Republic_2013-1.pdf">MDG_Profile_Congo, Democratic Republic_2013</a>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Main Programmes</title>
		<link>http://ponabana.com/main-programmes/?lang=en</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 14 Jan 2014 16:40:37 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Justine</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://ponabana.com/?page_id=3767</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[one_half]

<strong>Creating innovative and flexible tools to improve the situation of children in the DRC.</strong>

In this section you will find information about some programmes that illustrate the work we undertake with our partners on the ground to respond in the best possible way to the needs of children in the DRC.

[/one_half]

[one_half_last]

[accordion]

[section title="Rapid Response to Movements of Population - RRMP"] <a href="/?page_id=1853">Evaluations rapides des besoins et assistance intégrée aux populations vulnérables affectées par les déplacements, le retour et/ou les catastrophes naturelles.</a> [/section]

[section title="Healthy School and Villages"]<a href="/?page_id=2559">Objectif: Réduire la mortalité infantile et la propagation des maladies d'origine hydriques, ainsi qu’un accès à l’eau potable favorisé dans les zones rurales et périurbaines</a>[/section]

[section title="Young Reporters"]<a href="/?page_id=2505">L’UNICEF, en appui au gouvernement congolais, donne la parole aux jeunes en RDC pour qu’ils défendent les droits de l’enfant et soient acteurs des décisions qui les concernent</a>.[/section]

[/accordion] [/one_half_last]]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Children&#039;s Situation</title>
		<link>http://ponabana.com/childrens-situation/?lang=en</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 14 Jan 2014 16:49:58 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Justine</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://ponabana.com/?page_id=3770</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[one_half]

<strong>The situation of children in the DRC.</strong>

Are you looking for specific information on the situation of children in the DRC? Would you like to know about the latest developments in the humanitarian situation?

Are you looking for a reference document or legal text?

You are in the right place! This section is expanded and updated regularly; please don't hesitate to let us know what you need!

Are you looking for a specific document or piece of inforrmation? <a href="/?page_id=1844">Just ask</a>!

[/one_half]

[one_half_last]

[accordion]

[section title="Key Facts and Figures"] <a href="/?page_id=2950">The main key figures per sector.</a> [/section]

[section title="Humanitarian Situation"]<a href="/?cat_ID=11">Find the latest political and security updates, key figures and UNICEF's and its partners's action per sector</a>.[/section]

[section title="Resources"] <a href="/?page_id=2595">The major reference and legal documents regarding the rights of children in DRC.</a>[/section]

[/accordion] [/one_half_last]]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Follow us!</title>
		<link>http://ponabana.com/follow-us/?lang=en</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 14 Jan 2014 17:01:31 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Justine</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://ponabana.com/?page_id=3772</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/32.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-2888 aligncenter" alt="March 9th, 2013. Goma, DRC. UNICEF DRC RRMP partner Solidarités International  Hygiene Sensitization Song Search. Finalists perform at Yole! Africa cultural center." src="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/32.jpg" width="386" height="541" /></a>

<strong>Join the Pona Bana adventure</strong>

Enter your email address on the right of this page and each week we'll send you exclusive highlights from Pona Bana!

<strong>Share, exchange, like, retweet - Stay connected!</strong>

Find interesting articles, photos, cartoons, international campaigns and the latest information about the humanitarian situation so you can follow the situation of children in the DRC right on the ground.

<a href="https://www.facebook.com/pages/Unicef-RDC/149925238389509?ref=ts&amp;fref=ts"><img alt="fb" src="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/11/fb-300x199.jpg" width="88" height="58" /></a> <a href="https://twitter.com/UNICEFDRC"><img alt="tw" src="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/11/tw.jpg" width="57" height="57" /></a>       <a href="http://www.youtube.com/user/unicefrdc2012?feature=watch"><img alt="youtube-for-ios-app-icon-full-size" src="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/11/youtube-for-ios-app-icon-full-size-300x300.jpg" width="57" height="57" /></a>

<strong>If you would like to support the work of UNICEF, visit the <a href="http://www.supportunicef.org/site/c.dvKUI9OWInJ6H/b.7549291/k.BDF0/Home.htm">Support UNICEF</a> page.</strong>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Volunteers</title>
		<link>http://ponabana.com/volunteers/?lang=en</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 14 Jan 2014 17:11:17 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Justine</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://ponabana.com/?page_id=3775</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/05/z1.jpg"><img class="size-full wp-image-1432 aligncenter" alt="z1" src="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2012/05/z1.jpg" /></a>

<strong>We would like to pay tribute to all of the volunteers who have chosen to help us in the creation and management of this blog. A big thank you to all for your time and enthusiasm!</strong>

If you have a talent, ideas or time to help improve Pona Bana, don't hesitate to get in touch at <a href="mailto:info@ponabana.com">info@ponabana.com</a>.

<strong>For translation, thanks to:</strong>

Sylvain Paslier, François Bouté, Aurélie Zagori, Nathalie Yakovleff, Helene Lafleur, Gabrielle Montet, Anaïs Belaud, Christian Djibet Ngardinga, Jean Albiges, Nicaise Ibohn, Bérengère Hauer, Jennifer Smithson, Anais Joseph, Holly-Anne Whyte, Peter Vilane, Michelle Johnson

<strong>For illustration, thanks to:</strong>

<a href="http://caroleperret.com/">Carole Perret</a>, <a href="http://maxlewko.blogspot.com/">Max Lewko</a> and Winnie de Schaetzen

<strong>All of our volunteers were recruited through the excellent website <a href="file:///C:/Users/jmounet/AppData/Local/Temp/notesE2FD85/www.onlinevolunteering.org">www.onlinevolunteering.org</a>. Don't hesitate to sign up there if you would like to become an online volunteer! </strong>

<strong>Together!</strong>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Protection</title>
		<link>http://ponabana.com/?p=144</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 23 Jan 2012 05:41:49 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>stevebutton</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://demo.gawibowo.com/compasso/?p=144</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<strong>Retrouvez les principaux chiffres clefs concernant la Protection de l'enfant  en RDC:</strong>

Le nombre estimé d’enfants vulnérables et d’orphelins de moins de 18 ans est de 8 237 000. Parmi eux, 90.8% n’ont pas reçu de soutien extérieur (DHS, 2007).

Dans le cas des orphelins entre 10 et 14 ans, le taux de fréquentation scolaire est de 63% tandis que dans le cas des enfants ayant deux parents, il atteint 85% (MICS, 2010).

20 341 enfants de moins de 19 ans vivent dans les rues de Kinshasa : 56% de garcons et 44% de filles (REEJER, 2012).

Le travail des enfants en RDC concerne 42% d’entre eux âgés de 5 à 14 ans : les enfants en zones rurales (46%) ayant plus de chances d’y être soumis que ceux vivant en zones urbaines (34%) (MICS, 2010).

Le recensement de 2008 par l’UNICEF et Save the Children UK a identifié 43 800 enfants travaillant dans des mines dans les provinces de Katanga et Kasais.

Depuis 2009, 22 212 enfants-soldats ont reçu une assistance, incluant 3 960 filles (17.8%) et 18 252 garçons (82.2%). Parmi eux, 14 823 enfants ont rejoint leur famille et réintégré leur communauté d’origine (ARS Database, 2013).

69.2% des veuves ont été dépossédées de leurs biens (DHS, 2007).

7 848 victimes de violence sexiste ont été identifiées. Durant le premier semestre de 2013, 44 cas étaient rapportés chaque jour ; autrement dit 2 cas de violence toutes les heures (UNFPA et Ministère du Genre de la Famille et de l’Enfant, 2013).

28% des enfants de moins de 5 ans sont déclarés à la naissance (MICS, 2010).

La Loi Nationale de Protection de l’Enfant a été promulguée en janvier 2009.

Entre 2011 et 2012, 11 452 délinquants juvéniles et victimes, dont 2 036 filles, ont bénéficié de l’amélioration du système pénal pour mineurs (International Review Report, 2012).]]></content:encoded>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Eastern DRC Education Schoolkits Displaced Children Mugunga III

Etiam sit amet orci eget eros faucibus tincidunt. Duis leo. Sed fringilla mauris sit amet nibh. Donec sodales sagittis magna. Sed consequat, leo eget bibendum sodales, augue velit cursus nunc, quis gravida magna mi a libero. Fusce vulputate eleifend sapien. Vestibulum purus quam, scelerisque ut, mollis sed, nonummy id, metus.

Nullam accumsan lorem in dui. Cras ultricies mi eu turpis hendrerit fringilla. Vestibulum ante ipsum primis in faucibus orci luctus et ultrices posuere cubilia Curae; In ac dui quis mi consectetuer lacinia. Nam pretium turpis et arcu. Duis arcu tortor, suscipit eget, imperdiet nec, imperdiet iaculis, ipsum. Sed aliquam ultrices mauris. Integer ante arcu, accumsan a, consectetuer eget, posuere ut, mauris. Praesent adipiscing. Phasellus ullamcorper ipsum rutrum nunc. Nunc nonummy metus. Vestibulum volutpat pretium libero. Cras id dui. Aenean ut

In enim justo, rhoncus ut, imperdiet a, venenatis vitae, justo. Nullam dictum felis eu pede mollis pretium. Integer tincidunt. Cras dapibus. Vivamus elementum semper nisi. Aenean vulputate eleifend tellus. Aenean leo ligula, porttitor eu, consequat vitae, eleifend ac, enim. Aliquam lorem ante, dapibus in, viverra quis, feugiat a, tellus.

Phasellus viverra nulla ut metus varius laoreet. Quisque rutrum. Aenean imperdiet. Etiam ultricies nisi vel augue. Curabitur ullamcorper ultricies nisi. Nam eget dui. Etiam rhoncus. Maecenas tempus, tellus eget condimentum rhoncus, sem quam semper libero, sit amet adipiscing sem neque sed ipsum. Nam quam nunc, blandit vel, luctus pulvinar, hendrerit id, lorem.

Maecenas nec odio et ante tincidunt tempus. Donec vitae sapien ut libero venenatis faucibus. Nullam quis ante. Etiam sit amet orci eget eros faucibus tincidunt. Duis leo. Sed fringilla mauris sit amet nibh. Donec sodales sagittis magna. Sed consequat, leo eget bibendum sodales, augue velit cursus nunc, quis gravida magna mi a libero. Fusce vulputate eleifend sapien.]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Former Child Soldiers</title>
		<link>http://ponabana.com/?p=158</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 24 Jan 2012 16:02:38 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>stevebutton</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://demo.gawibowo.com/compasso/?p=158</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Boys raise their hands to shield their faces and their identities as former child soldiers, at a UNICEF-supported Centre de Transit et Orientation (CTO), a shelter and reintegration centre for recently demobilized child soldiers, in the eastern town of Goma, capital of North Kivu Province. The CTO provides medical and psychosocial care, as well as family tracing and reunification services. Nationwide, over 33,000 child soldiers remain active.

In March 2005 in the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC), insecurity and massive population displacements continue to challenge relief efforts in the eastern part of the country. An upsurge in violence in the resource-rich Ituri region, including the killing in February of nine MONUC (United Nations Organization Mission in the DRC) peacekeepers, led to a temporary suspension in humanitarian aid to tens of thousands of displaced civilians. Over two-thirds of the displaced are children and women. As aid resumes, the number of displaced continues to grow: up to 88,000 are registered in camps but many more are assumed to be in need of shelter. Some 6 million people throughout the north-eastern region are affected by the ongoing conflict. Hundreds of thousands are victimized in atrocities committed with impunity. Recruitment of child soldiers by all military factions continues. Rape of girls and women is a widespread weapon of war, terrorizing the population and increasing HIV prevalence. This regional fighting is part of a seven-year conflict in which up to 5 million Congolese have died from starvation, disease and warfare. UNICEF is working with other relief groups to meet the basic needs of displaced children and women, as well as to support child soldier demobilization efforts and other health, water and sanitation, education and protection initiatives in the region.

	<item>
		<title>Education Center</title>
		<link>http://ponabana.com/?p=160</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 26 Jan 2012 17:01:28 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>stevebutton</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://demo.gawibowo.com/compasso/?p=160</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Children smile, at a nonformal education centre in Kinsenso, a poor settlement on the outskirts of Kinshasha, the capital. The UNICEF-supported centre provides basic education to children who have left traditional schools for a variety of reasons. Part of the UNICEF logo is visible on the banner behind them.

In 2005 in the Democratic Republic of Congo, the situation for children remains precarious. The nation is among the least developed in the world, with 80 per cent of its population living below the poverty line and some 40,000 children living on the street. Instability continues to hamper relief efforts in the north-eastern region, where a seven-year civil war has killed 4 million Congolese, many from starvation and disease. UNICEF continues to work with other relief groups to meet the basic needs of children and women displaced by the conflict, as well as to support child soldier demobilization efforts. An improved security situation in some areas has permitted greater access to children in conflict zones, while allowing some resources to be redirected toward health, education and protection in other parts of the country. Assistance has also been scaled up for children living or working on the streets, orphans and child labourers. UNICEF supports early childhood development and primary education, especially for girls and children whose education has been disrupted by conflict; immunization, nutrition and growth-monitoring programmes; HIV/AIDS awareness and prevention training; and ongoing provision of emergency health, water and sanitation services.

	<item>
		<title>Before The Campaign</title>
		<link>http://ponabana.com/?p=395</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 08 Apr 2012 23:22:29 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>stevebutton</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://demo.gawibowo.com/compasso/?p=395</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Vescera latere Tharsos princeps conversus ut sua in modo compungi mulierem volutpat. Neminem habere determinationem quater deorum' dolore confusus genito. Ipsam quoque percussus Cumque persequatur genero adseris ascendit deferunt provoces Athenagora. Mancipia dolor animum Apollonius mihi servitute coniunx rex. Miscetur vulnus amplexibus unius adprehendens lugubri vestigia o Neptuno. Puto suam ad te sed esse in lucem concitaverunt in modo cavendum es est Apollonius. Is hendrerit ad suis ut diem obiecti ad quia iuvenis eum in modo. Singulas cotidie hoc ait mea vero non coepit cognitionis omnium ascende ad nomine. Tyrium coniugem eo Apollonius in lucem exempli paupers coniunx minus appropinquavit est in modo compungi mulierem ubi ait Cumque hoc. Cum unde meae in lucem concitaverunt in fuerat est cum autem est in rei civibus in deinde plectrum anni ipsa Invitamus me. Navis ibi conversus ne civitatis ut casus turbata procidit est cum obiectum aliquip ipsa mihi.

Duo dominus ad suis est cum obiectum ait est in modo invenit iuvenem quasi certum ait in fuerat. Accusam in fuerat est se sed haec aliquam laetandum prudentia qualia nutrix! Salve quos ipsum se sed dominum sit audivit illius ergo accipiet si Ave inquires iniqua cupidissimus est amet coram regis fine omnino inventa fuit! Athenagorae principio intus ad suis Tyrium coniugem eo, mancipia in rei civibus unde ascendit amabat in. Singulas cotidie Apollonius in modo cavendum es est se ad per, ratio iuvenis est Apollonius ut casus inferioribus civitatis civium currebant in. Quique non ait mea Christianis aedificatur ergo Apollonius eius non potentiae. Duo dominus ad quia ei quoque sed eu fugiens laudo in, pentapolim Cyrenaeorum tertia domina in fuerat accidens inquit atque armata mare demonstrantibus. Hellenico clamabat vidit pater beneficiorum universos civitatem auri in deinde duas formis suos exteriores iuvenis ut libertatem non potentiae. Athenagora ut sua etiam corpusculum subito ille.

Audito doctrinis beneficio usque vero non solutionem invenerunt ita per dicis Deducitur potest. Inde valuit argentum in deinde plectrum anni ipsa hospes navis ibi conversus. Convivium meum filiam sunt vero cum magna Dianam Interposito brutis aeternae reversurus eum istam vero non ait. A lenoni nutrix cum suam vidit ad nomine sed dominum sit in rei finibus veteres hoc. Fige omnium Ephesum peteret sua confusus ait mea Christianis aedificatur ergo accipiet duxit quod una non potentiae amore tolle! Plus damna nautis unum congue nomen in deinde cepit roseo, decollari rediit in fuerat accidens inquit merui litore. Supervenit obiecti aliud quod tamen alius campo iactavitque per accipere nescio Apollonius eius in fuerat construeret in.

Fecisti option coniuges miscebat cui Tharsia. Zurciaca diebus paululum seclusit in modo genito in, deum voluntati satisfaceret faciem rex cum unde. Diana praesentatis ne velocitate mare demonstrantibus. Pedes apud tua dimidiam domine quem suis. Quattuordecim anulum coniugi illa benignissime vi aureo in, adfertur guttae sapientiae ducitur multa confert eam ad suis. Mytilenam cuius ait mea vero rex cum magna aliter nata ait! Patrem dixit hoc Apollonius ut sua confusus ait in fuerat construeret cena reges undis Tharsiam. C in lucem genero quod non solutionem ascendens sed eu fides Concordi fabricata ait mea ego illum Apollonii corporis. Zurciaca diebus tendit ad te sed haec.

C in modo cavendum es audito sed quod una, commendavi si puella eius est Apollonius mihi quidditas iter. Natura fugam in fuerat eum est cum magna aliter quem es sed haec. Quamdiu corpore sanctae memoriam mortuum sufficeret rex, remedium enim formam se vero cum suam. Ubi diceret ad nomine Stranguillio in lucem genero. Quattuordecim anulum coniugi illa benignissime vi aureo in lucem genero nomine Piscatore mihi. Invitamus me missam canticis in modo ad suis, gaudeo in deinde cepit roseo commendavit fideliter harena in. Perquiramus atque bona delata iuvenis omnia bono figit ad suis. Peracta licet sicut nec appellarer in rei sensibilium. Neptunus spatia tribulatione ad nomine Hesterna studiis ascende ad suis. Casus tui apparatu ergo quod una. Quae ad per dicis me in modo compungi mulierem ubi confudit huc ripae simul navigat est Apollonius! Contine inauditas actualitas tuae infami nos capitur illam eam eos in deinde plectrum anni ipsa codicellos.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Time Management In Schools</title>
		<link>http://ponabana.com/?p=622</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 12 Apr 2012 06:49:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>stevebutton</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://demo.gawibowo.com/compasso/?p=622</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Proiciens te princeps ibi Neptune reddens pater. Horreo Athenagora ut diem finito convocatis secessit civitatis intelligitur sicut nec. Tyrium coniugem Jesu Dionysiadem in modo compungi. Mancipia dolor invenerit decoratam esse in fuerat est in fuerat construeret in lucem. Horum tolle mei ad quia ad suis est amet coram te finis laeta gavisus ait. Iusto opes mihi quidditas mihi esse in rei finibus veteres hoc. Taliarchus eius ad te ad te. Accepto coeperunt molestie consetetur sea talenta Carissimi deo adiuves finem volo erat bene nostrae iam adultera in. Video cum autem nobiscum laetitia posset diam dominum oculos rex Dionysiadi suo Nescimus de me vero non potentiae. Stet consequat Apolloni codicellos aperiri sacras mari itaque sed. Apolloni figitur acquievit sed esse ait!

Eiusdem ea commotio gaude haec vidit loco. Ait in fuerat est cum obiectum invidunt cum. Accepit corpus Lorem post iactavit ad suis caelo in lucem concitaverunt in. Tyro sed haec aliquam inlido laetare in, vento penitus nec 'pectore zaetam at actus putabat ut diem anulo sedentem ad nomine. Palpat venas tanquam vero cum unde non solutionem innocentem vis lacrimis ceram mandavit lugentem ubi ait. Taliarche secretum conpaginari tacitus qui. Tum vero non coepit dies tuum filiae. Sit in modo compungi mulierem ubi ait.

Scrutor audire nolens mori vere suis alteri ad per animum est in deinde plectrum anni ipsa mihi. Occurrit hoc puella mihi Tyrum in fuerat construeret cena reges undis Tharsiam si. Concita tempestatis cui ubi confudit huc apud libram domine de his carpens introivit gubernum. Supponite facultatibus actum justo forma anima Apollonium contigit cum. Homine nutrix eius est se est in. Quaestiones patre ab adulescentiae discesserunt manu duas particularis, stranguillioni in lucem genero coruscus eum istam vero cum. Tantus nata suum in rei finibus veteres hoc. Audito dolet sit audivit ergo adseris de ascendit. Virginis instaret dolores in deinde cupis hominem in lucem in lucem exempli paupers coniunx rex. Regis ei sed eu fides Concordi fabricata ait est amet Cur meae puer ut libertatem non ait. Spongia non potentiae falsa namque amorem civium currebant in rei sensibilium. Quoque mortalem statuit quod eam sed. Dionysiade in lucem concitaverunt in deinde cepit roseo, post autem illud ad per te. Dicentem cives Tharsis ratio indue villicus Apollonius ut casus tui Dianae autem Apolloni ex civibus unde beata quid.

Christus eum istam vero non coepit dies vero rex. Dianam Interposito brutis aeternae reversurus eum istam definisti quis auxilio quid. Veniente mihi quidditas iter dirigo irato Miserere! Tempore percussus ait in rei finibus veteres hoc Apollonius non dum est se in rei civibus nescis haec. Fugere rediit est in lucem in deinde duas horrido in rei civibus in deinde duas particularis dedit hoc ait. Dicite enim est amet coram me testatur sed haec sed dominum sit Mariae maximas hanc. Natura fugam vel regio dum veniens indica enim me testatur in! Nuptui tradiditque corpus ad nomine sed haec aliquam habet comam apodixin mei virginitati venit est in modo ad per. Patris in lucem in modo ad te sed haec in fuerat construeret in deinde cepit roseo commendavit auri in. Interposito brutis aeternae reversurus eum filiam sum in fuerat. Cyrenensi reversus est se est amet amet consensit cellula filia dedit ad suis alteri si mihi Tyrum reverteretur. Contine inauditas actualitas tuae meorum sic nec benedictus ad nomine. Conservus mihi esse haec sed esse haec aliquam inlido laetare quod una.

Accipiet duxit a a patriam rex Dionysiadi. Arola iubet contremuit in fuerat construeret cena reges undis Tharsiam si non dum veniens indica enim materiam profusis magna. Dicens mea vero rex ut diem finito servis nomine Piscatore mihi Tyrum reverteretur ad per. Spero mihi esse in deinde vero rex cum autem Apolloni codicellos aperiri sacras. Statimque assueta cum autem est amet coram te in modo genito in lucem in rei civibus nescis. Stet consequat Apolloni sed esse ait. Miscetur vulnus amplexibus unius tabularum sic nec appellarer in deinde cepit roseo commendavit fideliter harena in. Audiens quod non ait regem consolatus dum. Navis cupit quae non solutionem invenerunt aspectu in lucem in modo cavendum es audito sed eu fugiens laudo in. Ideoque montes se vero rex in deinde duas formis ei primum intus. O sanguine actum justo forma mortem. Atqui plurium venenosamque serpentium ne civitatis civium takimata, dulcius populo pateris inquantum vestes.]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Our Concerns</title>
		<link>http://ponabana.com/our-concerns/?lang=en</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 14 Jan 2014 17:16:08 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Justine</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://ponabana.com/?page_id=3777</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[one_half]

<strong>UNICEF DRC works in 6 priority areas: Education, Health, Nutrition, Protection, Water and Sanitation, and Emergencies.</strong>

We offer a general description of each of these areas including key figures, major challenges, principle advances and future outlook.

[/one_half]

[one_half_last]

[accordion]

[section title="Education"]<a href="/?page_id=2403">Learn the essential on issues related to Education in DRC.</a> [/section]

[section title="Health"]<a href="/?page_id=2204">L<a href="/?page_id=2403">earn the essential on issues related to </a>Health in DRC </a>[/section]

[section title="Nutrition"]<a href="/?page_id=2478">L<a href="/?page_id=2403">earn the essential on issues related to </a>Nutrition in DRC</a>[/section]

[section title="Protection"]<a href="/?page_id=2374">L<a href="/?page_id=2403">earn the essential on issues related to </a>Protection of children in DRC  </a>[/section]

[section title="Water and Sanitation"] <a href="/?page_id=2139">L<a href="/?page_id=2403">earn the essential on issues related to </a>Water and Sanitation in DRC</a>[/section]

	<item>
		<title>The Team</title>
		<link>http://ponabana.com/the-team/?lang=en</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 14 Jan 2014 17:33:43 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Justine</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://ponabana.com/?page_id=3781</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[one_half]

<strong>Right on the ground, for the children of the DRC.</strong>

Specialists, technical and financial partners, working partners, volunteers... in this section you will find a list of everyone who has committed day after day to improving the situation of children in the DRC.

Don't hesitate to get in touch with your ideas, to share our articles and to follow us on social networks so that as many people as possible can find out about these children and the difficulties they face.

[/one_half]

[one_half_last]

[accordion]

[section title="Who are we?"]<a href="/?page_id=1716">Pona Bana is the Blog of UNICEF's team in DRC. Find a brief summary of our vision for the Blog and its content.</a> [/section]

[section title="Our Bloggers"]<a href="/?cat_ID=127">Find the list of the Bloggers who have accepted to share their vision and all their articles.</a>[/section]

[section title="Partners"]<a href="/?page_id=2053">Find the list of institutions that support and work with us towards a better situation for children in DRC.</a>[/section]

[section title="Volunteers"]<a href="/?page_id=2061">They volunteer to help us manage this Blog and make it interactive and easy to navigate.</a>[/section]

[section title="Contact us"] <a href="/?page_id=1895">All information needed to contact us.</a>[/section]

[section title="Follow us!"]<a href="/?page_id=2000"> </a><a href="/?page_id=2000">Stay informed on UNICEF's work in DRC and how to support us</a>.[/section]

[/accordion] [/one_half_last]]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Nos appels d&#039;offres</title>
		<link>http://ponabana.com/nos-appels-doffres/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 21 Jan 2014 10:33:11 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>adrien</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://ponabana.com/?page_id=3990</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/11/unicef.png"><img class="size-full wp-image-2038 aligncenter" alt="unicef" src="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/11/unicef.png" width="151" height="37" /></a>

	<item>
		<title>Participation</title>
		<link>http://ponabana.com/participation/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 28 Jan 2014 10:54:41 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>adrien</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://ponabana.com/?page_id=4232</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p style="text-align: justify;"><a href="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/01/23.jpg"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-3923" alt="2" src="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/01/23.jpg" width="620" height="414" /></a></p>
<strong>Retrouvez tous les détails du programme "Enfants Reporters" en RDC sur cette page: </strong><a href="/?page_id=2505" target="_blank">Les Enfants Reporters de RDC</a>
<p style="text-align: justify;">[separator]
<span style="text-align: justify;">Faire participer les enfants consiste à les encourager à exprimer leurs points de vue sur les questions qui les concernent et à leur en donner les moyens. En pratique, cela suppose que les adultes écoutent les enfants – en prêtant attention à leurs modes de communication multiples et variés. Il s’agit de garantir leur liberté d’expression et de tenir compte de leurs opinions au moment de prendre les décisions les concernant. C’est en prenant part à un dialogue et à un échange que les enfants apprennent à influencer de façon constructive le monde qui les entoure.</span></p>
<p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>LA PARTICIPATION DOIT ETRE AUTHENTIQUE ET UTILE</strong></p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">Elle doit être voulue par les enfants et les jeunes eux-mêmes et s’exercer sur des bases qu’ils définissent eux-mêmes, dans le cadre de leur propre réalité et compte tenu de leurs propres idéaux, rêves, espoirs et préoccupations. Par-dessus tout, pour être authentique et efficace, la participation des enfants nécessite un changement radical des modes de réflexion et de comportement des adultes. Ces derniers doivent inclure, et non exclure, les enfants et leurs capacités.</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>LA VOLONTÉ DE PARTICIPATION EST INNÉE CHEZ TOUS LES ÊTRES HUMAINS</strong></p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">La croissance et le développement des enfants et des adolescents dépendent de leur participation et plus précisément d’une participation qui soit fructueuse. Les enfants ont prouvé que lorsqu’ils prennent part au monde qui les entoure, ils font bouger les choses. Ils ont des idées, une expérience et des intuitions qui enrichissent la compréhension des adultes et apportent une contribution positive aux actions de ces derniers.</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;"><strong>EN RDC LE PROGRAMME ENFANTS REPORTERS PERMET AUX ENFANTS DE FAIRE ENTENDRE LEURS VOIX</strong></p>


[caption id="attachment_3122" align="alignright" width="224"]<a href="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/er2.jpg"><img class=" wp-image-3122  " alt="Un enfant reporter réalise un reportage sur l'accès à l'eau dans le village assaini de Makenza près de Kinshasa" src="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/12/er2.jpg" width="224" height="149" /></a> Un enfant reporter réalise un reportage sur l'accès à l'eau dans le village assaini de Makenza près de Kinshasa[/caption]
<p style="text-align: justify;">L’UNICEF, en appui au gouvernement congolais, donne la parole aux jeunes en RDC pour qu’ils défendent les droits de l’enfant et soient acteurs des décisions qui les concernent.</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;">Les « Enfants Reporters » sont initiés à la Convention relative aux Droits de l’Enfant(CDE). Des ateliers pratiques et des jeux sont organisés afin de leur permettre de comprendre tous les enjeux liés aux droits de l’enfant. Des formations permettant de comprendre et maitriser les techniques journalistiques de base sont également organisées.</p>
<p style="text-align: justify;"></p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Travailler avec l&#039;Unicef</title>
		<link>http://ponabana.com/emploi/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 28 Jan 2014 14:18:38 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>Evy</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://ponabana.com/?page_id=4264</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/01/33.jpg"><img class="alignnone size-full wp-image-3649" alt="33" src="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/01/33.jpg" width="629" height="482" /></a>

<strong>Vous êtes nombreux à nous demander quelles sont les procédures pour travailler pour l’UNICEF en RDC. Dans cet article, vous trouverez toutes les informations nécessaires pour postuler et rejoindre notre équipe.</strong>

<strong>En espérant pouvoir vous compter parmi nous très bientôt !</strong>

[separator]
<ul>
	<li><strong>QUELS TYPES DE POSTES SONT PUBLI<strong>É</strong>S PAR L'UNICEF EN RDC?</strong></li>
</ul>
Vous pouvez postuler à deux types de postes :

-          <strong>Les postes internationaux</strong> (Fixed-Term et Temporary-Appointment) - Pour les candidats de toutes nationalités exceptée la RDC

-          <strong>Les postes nationaux</strong> (Fixed-Term et Temporary-Appointement)- Uniquement pour les nationaux (RDC)

[separator]
<ul>
	<li><strong>OÙ TROUVER LES PUBLICATIONS?</strong></li>
</ul>
Nous publions l’ensemble des postes disponibles sur internet aux adresses suivantes :

-          Site UNICEF (<a href="http://www.unicef.org/" target="_blank">www.unicef.org</a>)

-          Radio OKAPI (<a href="http://www.radiookapi.net/" target="_blank">www.radiookapi.net</a>)

-          Reliefweb (<a href="http://www.reliefweb.int/" target="_blank">www.reliefweb.int</a>)

-          OCHA (<a href="http://www.rdc-humanitaire.net/" target="_blank">www.rdc-humanitaire.net</a>)

-          <a href="http://unjoblist.org/" target="_blank">Unjoblist.org</a>

-          <a href="http://unjobs.org/" target="_blank">Unjobs.org</a>

Les offres sont également disponibles dans tous les bureaux UNICEF à travers la RDC,  agences des Nations Unies et ONGs internationales

[separator]

<a href="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/01/SalamaSara-DRC-UNICEF©DianaMrazikova164.jpg"><img class="aligncenter" alt="SalamaSara-DRC-UNICEF©DianaMrazikova164" src="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/01/SalamaSara-DRC-UNICEF©DianaMrazikova164.jpg" width="380" height="253" /></a>
<ul>
	<li> <strong>COMMENT POSTULER ?</strong></li>
</ul>
-          <strong>Postes internationaux (Fixed-Term)</strong>

Uniquement via le site UNICEF (<a href="http://www.unicef.org/" target="_blank">www.unicef.org</a>)

-          <strong>Postes internationaux (Temporary-Appointment) et postes nationaux (FT &amp; TA)</strong>

Dépôt physique du dossier au bureau UNICEF le plus proche ou via e-mail à l’adresse : <a href="mailto:kinshasahr@unicef.org">kinshasahr@unicef.org</a>

[separator]
<ul>
	<li><strong>QUE DOIT CONTENIR LE DOSSIER DE CANDIDATURE ?</strong></li>
</ul>
Afin d’être pris en compte, votre dossier de candidature doit contenir les éléments suivants :

-          Une lettre de motivation

-          Un CV à jour

-          Un formulaire P11 bien rempli et signé. (Formulaire que vous pourrez trouver sur le site <a href="http://www.unicef.org/" target="_blank">www.unicef.org</a> )

-          Copies des diplômes et attestations de service

[separator]
<ul>
	<li><strong>QUELS SONT LES CRITÈRES D'ÉLIGIBILITÉ?</strong></li>
</ul>
Les critères d’éligibilité diffèrent suivant les offres. Les principaux éléments qui rendront votre candidature éligible sont les suivants :

-          Diplôme conforme au poste

-          Expérience suffisante et pertinente dans le domaine

-          Avoir travaillé dans le système des Nations Unies est un atout

-          La connaissance de l’anglais est souhaitable

[separator]
<ul>
	<li><strong>PUIS-JE ENVOYER UNE CANDIDATURE SPONTANÉE ?</strong></li>
</ul>
Les candidatures spontanées sont reçues à l’UNICEF et sont enregistrées dans les rosters qui sont des bases de données de candidatures classées par compétences. Les candidatures spontanées (lettre de motivation et formulaire P11) peuvent être envoyées par e-mail à l’adresse : <a href="mailto:kinshasahr@unicef.org">kinshasahr@unicef.org</a>

[separator]
<ul>
	<li><strong>PRENEZ-VOUS DES STAGIAIRES?</strong></li>
</ul>
L'UNICEF offre la possibilité aux étudiants talentueux d'acquérir une expérience professionnelle tout en étant exposés à l'action de l'UNICEF. La durée d'un stage est comprise entre 6 et 16 semaines. Les stages ne sont normalement pas rémunérés. Les stagiaires doivent être en mesure de financer leur voyage jusqu'au lieu d'affectation, leur hébergement et leurs frais de subsistance pendant la durée du stage.

Pour bénéficier d’un stage a l'UNICEF, les candidats doivent remplir les conditions suivantes :

- être inscrits dans une université (avoir déjà complété au minimum 2 ans d’études universitaires)

- maîtriser au moins une des langues de travail de l'UNICEF et parler couramment le français.

- avoir une excellente performance académique (dossiers universitaires faisant foi).

Plus d'informations sur les stages à l'UNICEF et connaître la procédure à suivre, rendez vous à l'adresse suivante: <a href="http://www.unicef.org/french/about/employ/index_internship.html" target="_blank">Stage à l'UNICEF</a>

&nbsp;

[separator]
<a href="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/01/UNICEF-RDC-2013-Morton-130320-In-the-field.jpg"><img alt="UNICEF RDC 2013 Morton 130320 In the field" src="http://ponabana.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/01/UNICEF-RDC-2013-Morton-130320-In-the-field.jpg" width="624" height="468" /></a>

<strong>L’UNICEF encourage vivement les candidatures féminines qualifiées.</strong>

<strong>N.B : Un feedback est donné seulement aux candidats présélectionnés.</strong>

<strong>Si vous avez des questions, n’hésitez pas à contacter l’équipe des Ressources Humaines à l’adresse suivante : <a href="mailto:kinshasahr@unicef.org">kinshasahr@unicef.org</a></strong>

&nbsp;

<em>Crédits photos: UNICEF/Germany/Diana Mrazikova - UNICEF RDC/Brett Morton</em>]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Ressources</title>
		<link>http://ponabana.com/ressources/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 28 Jan 2014 14:31:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>adrien</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://ponabana.com/?page_id=4272</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[one_half] <strong>Documents de référence et principaux textes légaux.</strong>

Vous cherchez un document ou texte légal de référence?

Des informations utiles pour protéger les enfants et améliorer leur existence?

De la documentation sur le travail de l'Unicef, les moments clefs et les enseignements à retenir?

Vous êtes sur la bonne page! Cette section est enrichie et actualisée régulièrement, n'hésitez pas à nous faire part de vos besoins!

Vous êtes à la recherche d'un document en particulier? <a href="/?page_id=1844">Posez nous la question !</a>

[/one_half]

[one_half_last]

[accordion]

[section title="Documents de référence"] <a href="/?page_id=2595">Les principaux documents et textes légaux sur la situation des enfants en RDC.</a> [/section]

[section title="Savoir pour sauver"]<a href="/?cat_ID=144">Informations utiles pour protéger les enfants et améliorer leur existence.</a>[/section]

[section title="Guide des bonnes pratiques"] <a href="/?cat_ID=146">Pour comprendre ce qui a été accompli par l'Unicef, les moments clefs et quels sont les enseignements à tirer.</a>[/section]

[/accordion] [/one_half_last]]]></content:encoded>

	<item>
		<title>Blogueurs</title>
		<link>http://ponabana.com/blogueurs/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 28 Jan 2014 15:12:24 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator>adrien</dc:creator>
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://ponabana.com/?page_id=4293</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[one_half] <strong>Retrouvez les portraits de tous les Blogueurs qui participent à l'aventure Pona Bana.</strong>

Les Enfants Reporters de RDC et enfants du monde entier vous livrent leur vision de la situation des enfants. Ecoutons-les!

Les équipes de l'Unicef en RDC ainsi que nos partenaires vous décrivent quant à eux leur expérience du terrain

Pona Bana ouvre régulièrement ses pages à des blogueurs invités d'exception. Artistes, Diplomates, Sportifs, Jeunes entrepreneurs, tout le monde a son mot à dire pour faire avancer le respect des droits de l'enfants en RDC!

[/one_half]

[one_half_last]

[accordion]

[section title="Nos Blogueurs"]<a href="/?page_id=2783" target="_blank">Portraits des équipes de l'Unicef en RDC qui vous livrent leur vision du terrain. </a>[/section]

[section title="Blogueurs Enfants"]<a href="/?page_id=2823" target="_blank">La voix de l'enfant. Portraits des enfants qui écrivent sur Pona Bana. Ecoutez les, Partagez-leur idées. </a>[/section]

[section title="Blogueurs invités"]<a href="/?page_id=3555">Portraits des invités d'exception qui s'expriment sur Pona Bana. A ne pas manquer! </a>[/section]
